body: What was with that sudden change in character for the sister? It makes no sense. She went from appreciating him, to completely ruining his emotional mindset in the snap of a finger. I can only think that she is doing it out of jealousy, but she was never jealous of her brother. That only makes her character switch all the more confusing. Maybe it was due to his earlier remarks, but he clearly regretted it when he apologized to her. I looked back and what? She hates him because he has a small penis? What? How does that make sense? His girlfriend's character is about as all over the place as his sister's too. Why did she start hating him? He had an average bodily reaction to a situation that would trigger said bodily reaction. Do people really have to make contrived nonsense to make a netorare story? Is that all this genre can do? What a waste of potential of both the story and genre. Sorry about the rant, I just like having a cohesive tragic story.

With this incident, he'll slowly spiral downwards from here on out. He won't do well in Tennis. He'll suddenly lash out on people, casuing them to hate him. His sister will continuously mock him other than his size. His ex-girlfriend will constantly remind him of why he lost her.

Due to his kind attitude, this can end in different and extreme ways.

1. He would run away from home and forget about everyone he held dear. Heck, he might even fake his own death just so everyone would move on (if they still care for him). Not like his sister nor ex would care about him, anyway. So there's no need to feel bad about leaving them.

2. He'll snap and keep his sister and ex somewhere. In a place where no one could find them anymore. What happens next would either be rape, ryona, torture, guro, or a combination of any of these. It's not like they're sorry anyway.

3. He'll commit suicide for feeling less of a human being. No one will care about him dying anyway, right?
